job_title: Network & Security Engineer – 5+ Years Experience ( Immediate Joiners)
job_description:
Network & Security Engineer

Kvaliteta Systems and Solutions is seeking a skilled Network & Security Engineer with 5+ years of experience to join our team in Technopark Phase III, Trivandrum.

About Us:

Kvaliteta Systems and Solutions is a global IT solutions provider delivering transformative services in Digital Transformation, IT Infrastructure, Private Cloud, Security, and Software Development as a Service (SDaaS). Our solutions help businesses accelerate growth and build secure, scalable environments in a digital-first world.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, implement, and manage SME and enterprise-level network and security solutions.
  • Configure and administer Palo Alto Networks Next-Generation Firewalls.
  • Deploy and support Cisco routing, switching, SD-WAN, data center, wireless, and Cisco DNAC solutions.
  • Implement and manage Cisco security platforms including Firepower, ASA, ISE, Umbrella, and DUO.
  • Maintain comprehensive documentation: HLD/LLD, network diagrams, WBS, UAT reports, and handover documentation.
  • Provide post-implementation support, including advanced troubleshooting and performance optimization.
  • Conduct Proof of Concepts (POCs) and technical demos for pre-sales and client onboarding.
  • Collaborate with sales and bid teams to contribute to RFP/RFI responses, solution architecture, BoMs, and technical proposals.
  • Identify and resolve network performance bottlenecks and security issues using industry best practices.
  • Stay updated on networking and security trends and pursue ongoing certifications.
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure successful design-to-deployment transitions.
  • Deliver technical leadership, mentorship, and participate in knowledge sharing across teams.

Required Skills & Certifications:

  • Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience in enterprise network implementation and support.
  • Strong knowledge of Cisco routing/switching (ISR/ASR, Catalyst, Nexus).
  • Experience with Cisco SD-WAN, DNAC, and Unified Communications.
  • Proficiency with VPNs, IDS/IPS, virtualization, and network function virtualization (NFV).
  • Strong exposure to Palo Alto NGFWs and security architecture.
  • Excellent skills in technical documentation and project handover.
  • Solid understanding of DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and automation is a plus.

Certifications:

  • Cisco CCNP (required)
  • Cisco CCIE (preferred)
  • PCNSE (Palo Alto Certified Network Security Engineer) or equivalent recognized security certifications (preferred)
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related discipline.

How to Apply:

Send your resume to hr@kvaliteta.in with “Network & Security Engineer” in the subject line. Please mention: Your Current CTC, Total Relevant Experience, Notice Period

Contact Information:

Email: hr@kvaliteta.in Website: http://www.kvaliteta.in Address: Kvaliteta Systems and Solutions (P) Ltd, SBC 2207, 2nd floor, Yamuna Tower, Technopark Phase 3 campus, Trivandrum-695583
summary: Seeking a Network & Security Engineer to design, implement, and manage network and security solutions. Proficiency in Cisco and Palo Alto technologies is essential.

job_description:
Software Test Engineer

Kvaliteta Systems and Solutions (P) Ltd is seeking an experienced Software Test Engineer to join our team in Technopark, Trivandrum. As a global IT solutions provider, we offer a wide range of services including Digital Transformation, Private Cloud, Infrastructure, Security, and Software Development as a Service. You will play a crucial role in ensuring the functionality, performance, and security of our platform.

Contact: hr@kvaliteta.in

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, maintain, and execute manual and automated test cases.
  • Create detailed unit tests and other test cases tailored to different user personas, ensuring each role and group functions as expected, and that front-end and back-end components operate correctly and cohesively.
  • Test API access and interactions based on permissions and roles, ensuring that security and data access control are properly enforced across different user profiles.
  • Conduct performance testing, focusing on page load times and overall platform responsiveness, identifying areas where optimization is required.
  • Test the integration of external systems such as API servers, and SSO (Single Sign-On) integrations, ensuring data flows smoothly between systems and functions as expected.
  • Validate role-based access and permissions for various user personas, ensuring that different user roles have the appropriate level of access to features and data.
  • Perform regular regression testing to ensure that new features or bug fixes do not negatively affect the existing functionality of the platform.
  • Ensure that security protocols, including authentication and authorization mechanisms, work properly and safeguard the system from vulnerabilities.
  • Collaborate with developers, business analysts, and stakeholders to understand requirements and provide detailed feedback on potential issues by Identifying and documenting the defects, track issues, and collaborate with the development team for resolution.
  • Design and implement automated tests for web and mobile applications and maintaining automated testing frameworks to streamline the testing process, especially for repetitive and critical functionality.
  • Work with the development team to enhance automation and manual testing processes.
  • Ensure high-quality standards through best testing practices.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field
  • 3+ years of experience in both manual and automation testing.
  • Strong expertise in Selenium, Java, and RESTful API testing.
  • Proficiency in manual testing methodologies and test case design.
  • Experience with CI/CD tools like Jenkins or GitLab.
  • Experience with performance testing tools and Techniques
  • Experience with bug tracking and test management tools
  • Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.

How to Apply: Interested candidates are invited to send their resumes to hr@kvaliteta.in with the job title as the subject. Please include your current CTC, relevant experience, and notice period in the email.
summary: Seeking a Software Test Engineer to ensure platform functionality, performance, and security through manual and automated testing. The ideal candidate has 3+ years of experience with Selenium, Java, and RESTful APIs.

job_description:

We are seeking a seasoned and data-driven HR operations leader to oversee and scale our end-to-end HR functions across the organization.   • Lead and optimize all core HR operations throughout the employee lifecycle: recruitment, onboarding, record management, payroll, benefits, offboarding, and compliance.
  • Design and implement efficient, technology-enabled processes that enhance accuracy, timeliness, and compliance across HR functions.
  • Champion the adoption of AI and automation tools to streamline recruitment, employee engagement, and analytics workflows.

🔹 Data-Driven HR Strategy

  • Build a strong HR analytics function delivering real-time dashboards and insights to support strategic decision-making.
  • Track and report on critical HR KPIs, including hiring efficiency, payroll accuracy, retention, engagement, and performance outcomes.
  • Leverage predictive and prescriptive analytics to improve workforce planning, reduce attrition, and boost productivity.

  • Partner with business leaders and HR stakeholders to manage and evolve the performance management cycle, including OKRs, feedback loops, appraisals, and talent calibration.
  • Ensure fair, timely, and consistent implementation of all performance-related programs and decisions.

🔹 Compliance, Risk & Governance

  • Ensure all HR policies, processes, and documentation comply with applicable labor laws, internal standards, and regulatory requirements.
  • Lead HR audits, risk assessments, and regular policy updates to mitigate legal and operational risks.

🔹 Team & Stakeholder Management

  • Build, mentor, and lead a high-performing HR operations team.
  • Collaborate closely with cross-functional partners in Finance, Legal, and IT to ensure seamless integration of shared services and enhance the employee experience.
  • Act as a trusted advisor to senior leadership on all operational HR matters, providing strategic input and operational insights.

Preferred Skills/Qualifications & Experience:

  • 15+ years of progressive HR experience, with at least 5+ years in a leadership role overseeing HR operations
  • Prior experience in product or technology companies with fast-paced, high-growth environments
  • Strong hands-on expertise in HR technology platforms (HRIS, ATS, payroll systems) and AI-enabled tools for recruitment, employee service, or performance management
  • Proven experience in delivering data-driven results across HR functions

  • Strong understanding of compliance and labor laws across regions (India/US/global preferred)

  • Certification in HR Analytics, AI in HR, Six Sigma, or SHRM/SPHR preferred
  • Proficiency in tools like Power BI, Tableau, Workday, Darwinbox, SAP SuccessFactors, or other HRMS tools

job_description:
Maverick Business Development Executive

Xminds Infotech is looking for a Maverick Business Development Executive to join our team! If you're an unconventional thinker and innovative doer, we want you!

About Xminds Infotech:

Welcome to Xminds Infotech, where boredom goes to die and creativity gets a corner office! We're not your average tech company—we're a launchpad for unconventional thinkers and innovative doers. Here, digital boundaries are made to be reimagined and every client interaction is a stage for playful genius. Our products and solutions span the globe, built by a team that isn’t afraid to rip up the script, raise the bar, and have fun doing it.

Your Mission:

As a Maverick Business Development Executive, you’ll be breaking barriers and mindsets. Get ready to:

  • Crack Open Conversations: Use wild wordplay, daring creativity, and a dash of mischief to connect with prospects and clients like never before.
  • Handle Objections Like a Game Show Host: Craft razor-sharp rebuttals and flip resistance into opportunity with a wink and a grin.
  • Invent, Don’t Imitate: Research new markets, invent irresistible outreach messages, and build communication gold from scratch.
  • Spark WOWs: Take every tricky situation as your next creative challenge, leaving clients surprised, delighted, and eager for more.
  • Harpoon the Goals: Own your pipeline. Drive revenue, but with the flair of an artist — never at the cost of authenticity or fun.

Preferred Skills:

We Want YOU If...

  • You have 0–2 years’ experience in B2B biz dev (or any role where you had to think on your feet and talk to real humans).
  • You know you’ve got the stuff: verbal agility, creative flair, and passion for all things tech.
  • English is your playfield: you connect, convince, and charm—no script needed, just your authentic voice (a neutral accent helps).
  • Objections? You say, “Bring them on!”—the tougher the spot, the bolder you get.
  • You’re ready to research markets, craft templates from scratch, and amp up team creativity.
  • You bounce back from fails stronger than ever, always hungry for the next win.
  • Tools like Salesforce/CRM excite you (or you’re pumped to master them).
  • You want more than a “job”—you want a place where trailblazing is celebrated and a little cheekiness is part of the culture.

Why Join Xminds Infotech?

Because originality wins here. If you’re unstoppable when challenged, fired up by new tech, and eager to make an impact (while having serious fun), this is your playground. Drop in, stand out, and let’s grow together—one bold client at a time!

Contact Information

Contact Email: careers@xminds.com

Closing Date: 31, Aug 2025 Job Published: 05, Aug 2025

Xminds Infotech (P) LtdModule no.T-4 and T-8, Thejaswini Building 7th floor, Phase 1, Technopark, Trivandrum , 695581 http://www.xminds.com

job_description:
Data Architect/Manager

Way.com is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Architect/Manager to join our fast-paced and innovative team. This role is ideal for someone who combines deep technical expertise with strategic leadership and is passionate about driving enterprise-wide data architecture initiatives that support scalability, efficiency, and informed decision-making.

About Way

Way is redefining the car ownership experience. As the nation’s leading Auto Super App, we empower millions of drivers across the U.S. to save on everything from insurance and parking to vehicle maintenance and roadside assistance. Our enterprise solutions also deliver powerful value to cities, fleets, and large organizations nationwide.

Key Responsibilities

As a Data Architect/Manager, you will:

  • Design, implement, and maintain robust and scalable data architectures, including database models, schemas, and overall infrastructure to support current and future business needs.
  • Lead and mentor a team of data engineers, analysts, and stakeholders—fostering a high-performance, collaborative, and excellence-driven culture.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with product, engineering, design, and business teams to translate organizational goals into efficient and scalable data solutions.
  • Evaluate, select, and oversee data platforms and technologies that align with long-term strategic objectives.
  • Monitor system performance and manage the full data lifecycle to ensure efficiency, reliability, and scalability.
  • Implement and enforce data governance policies, ensuring compliance with privacy laws, industry regulations, and internal standards.
  • Provide strategic direction for data initiatives, enabling executive decision-making through a solid architectural foundation.
  • Champion data best practices across departments, promoting data literacy and consistency across the organization.
  • Communicate progress, risks, and roadblocks to leadership, proactively addressing issues to drive timely and successful outcomes.

Preferred Skills and Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field.
  • 8+ years of professional experience in database development, data modeling, and architectural design.
  • Demonstrated success in managing teams or leading complex technical projects.
  • Relevant certifications such as CDMP, TOGAF, or equivalent are highly desirable.
  • Strong foundation in RDBMS principles, with hands-on experience in both relational and NoSQL database technologies.
  • Experience in the Networking or Security domain is a plus.
  • Practical expertise in API consumption and multi-tenant database design.
  • Proficiency in tools and technologies such as Oracle, MySQL, Cassandra, Talend, ETL tools, Hadoop, and more.
  • In-depth knowledge of database security, compliance practices, and regulatory frameworks.

Required Skills

  • Proven leadership and team management capabilities with a focus on mentoring, motivation, and team growth.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Exceptional attention to detail to maintain high standards in performance, accuracy, and security within system architecture.
  • Ability to balance leadership duties with technical execution while managing competing priorities.
  • Effective project and stakeholder management skills, focused on achieving measurable business outcomes.

Contact Information

  • Data-Driven HR Strategy:

  • Build a robust HR analytics function that provides real-time dashboards and insights to support business decisions.
  • Track and report KPIs across HR verticals: hiring efficiency, payroll accuracy, attrition, engagement scores, performance ratings, etc.

  • Drive predictive and prescriptive analytics to improve workforce planning, retention, and productivity.

  • Performance & People Management:

  • Partner with business and HR leadership to streamline and manage the performance management cycle, including OKRs, appraisals, feedback mechanisms, and talent calibration.

  • Ensure fair, consistent, and timely execution of performance-related processes.

  • Compliance, Risk & Governance:

  • Ensure HR policies, practices, and documentation comply with applicable employment laws and regulatory standards.

  • Oversee audits, risk assessments, and policy updates across all HR operations.

  • Team & Stakeholder Management:

  • Build and lead a high-performing HR operations team.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with Finance, IT, and Legal for process alignment, shared services, and employee experience.
  • Be a trusted advisor to the leadership team on operational HR matters.

Qualifications & Experience:

  • 15+ years of progressive HR experience, with at least 5+ years in a leadership role overseeing HR operations
  • Prior experience in product or technology companies with fast-paced, high-growth environments
  • Strong hands-on expertise in HR technology platforms (HRIS, ATS, payroll systems) and AI-enabled tools for recruitment, employee service, or performance management
  • Proven experience in delivering data-driven results across HR functions
  • Demonstrated ability to scale HR operations, build shared services models, and drive automation and process excellence
  • Strong understanding of compliance and labor laws across regions (India/US/global preferred)
  • Excellent leadership, project management, and communication skills

Preferred Attributes:

  • Experience working in global or distributed teams
  • Certification in HR Analytics, AI in HR, Six Sigma, or SHRM/SPHR preferred
  • Proficiency in tools like Power BI, Tableau, Workday, Darwinbox, SAP SuccessFactors, or other HRMS tools

What We Offer:

  • Opportunity to shape and scale the HR backbone of a rapidly growing product company
  • A culture that values innovation, transparency, impact, and data-driven decision-making
  • Competitive compensation, equity options, and leadership influence at a strategic level

Contact Information: careers@way.com
summary: Seeking a Senior Director - HR Operations to lead HR functions, drive HR strategy, and manage compliance. Must have experience with HR tech and analytics.
